TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are represented before the ORG by PERSON I.V. Novikov , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants are spouses . They receive old - age pensions .

On DATE the Law on ORG ( “ the LAW ” ) introduced a new method of calculation of retirement benefits based on so - called “ individual pensioner coefficient ” ( “ the ORG ” ) . The ORG was the ratio between an individual ’s wages at the moment of retirement and the national average rate and was meant to maintain a link between a person ’s pension and previous earnings .

The authority in charge of the applicants’ pensions – ORG of LOC of GPE ( “ the Fund ” ) – decided that the ORG to be applied to them should be CARDINAL . The applicants considered that this decision was arbitrary as it conflicted , in their opinion , with LAW . They brought a court action against the Fund for an increase of their pensions in accordance with LAW .

On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) found for the applicants . It held that since the defendant had misinterpreted LAW , the applicants’ pensions should be increased in line with an ORG of PERCENT . The court also recovered the pension arrears in the amount of MONEY ( RUB ) and indexation in the amount of RUB CARDINAL in favour of the first applicant , RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL and GPE respectively , in favour of the second applicant .
On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) rejected an appeal by the defendant . On DATE the judgment of DATE acquired legal force .

On DATE the ORG requested ORG to re - consider its judgment of DATE due to discovery of new circumstances . The ORG submitted that on DATE ORG had issued an Instruction on the Application of Limitations established by LAW ( “ the Instruction ” ) . The instruction clarified how LAW should be applied . The ORG contended that since it had been unaware of that instruction at the moment when the judgment was passed , the judgment would have to be reconsidered . The ORG claimed that it had learned about the ORG on DATE and requested ORG to postpone the enforcement proceedings of the judgment of DATE until the examination of the request to re - consider the judgment .
On DATE ORG rejected the defendant ’s request to postpone the enforcement proceedings . ORG upheld the decision on appeal on DATE .

On DATE the ORG submitted a new application for reconsideration of the judgment of DATE due to discovery of new circumstances . This time the ORG claimed that on DATE ORG of GPE had dismissed the complaint by a group of individuals challenging the ORG . ORG found that ORG had acted within its competence when it had issued the ORG , and that the ORG ’s interpretation of LAW had been correct . The ORG contended that since it had been unaware of the decision of DATE at the time of the judgment of DATE , the judgment would have to be reconsidered .

On DATE ORG granted the ORG ’s application . The ORG applied Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure according to which judgments could be re - considered in case of discovery of significant circumstances which were not and could not haven been known to the party concerned . The court found that the ORG , as upheld by ORG , could serve as such a circumstance . No appeal lay against this decision . The court quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , and remitted the case for a new examination to the first instance court . The first applicant was present at the hearing .
After a fresh examination on DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ claims in full having applied the Instruction . On DATE ORG rejected the ORG appeal against the judgment .

In the meantime , the applicants filed a new court action against ORG for wrong calculation of their retirement pension . On DATE ORG rejected their claims . By a decision of DATE ORG upheld the judgment .

Article CARDINAL of the RSFSR Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( in force at the material time ) provided for grounds for reconsideration of final judgments on the basis of “ newly - discovered circumstances ” . Such grounds included , inter alia , significant circumstances which were not and could not have been known to the party which applied for reconsideration , and invalidation of a court ruling or another authority ’s decision which had served as a legal basis for the judgment in question .
Article CARDINAL required that an application for reconsideration of a judgment owing to the discovery of new circumstances should be lodged within DATE after the discovery of the circumstances .

Pursuant to LAW on the basis of newly - discovered circumstances , should either grant such an application and quash the final judgment or dismiss the application . Such a decision was not amenable to appeal .
